meanings.definition: Convert (a check or other negotiable paper money) into cash.
meanings.sent1: She encashed her paycheck at the bank.
meanings.sent2: I need to encash this check before the bank closes.
meanings.sent3: The magician encashed the check and made it disappear!
meanings.sent4: He encashed the opportunity and turned it into profit.
meanings.sent5: Encashing the check felt like turning paper into gold.

meanings.definition: To exchange (a check or other negotiable paper money) for cash.
meanings.sent1: They encashed the traveler's check at the airport.
meanings.sent2: The teller encashed the check without any issues.
meanings.sent3: The kids encashed their allowance for some candy.
meanings.sent4: She encashed her luck for a big win at the casino.
meanings.sent5: Encashing the check was the final step to getting the money.

meanings.definition: To cash (a check or other negotiable paper money).
meanings.sent1: He encashed the check at the grocery store.
meanings.sent2: She encashed the money order at the post office.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel encashed the acorn for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Encashing the check was the first thing on his to-do list.
meanings.sent5: They encashed the voucher for a free meal.
